definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: Teachers to do a guide, students can learn self-protect.
sentences.chinese: 教师要做一个领路人，为学生的自能学习保驾护航。

sentences.english: The guides, as always, lie among the writers and artists.
sentences.chinese: 领路人依旧在作家和艺术家之中。

sentences.english: We thank Ksitigarbha for his help and Buddy Horse of A Thousand Miles for his leading the road.
sentences.chinese: 我们感谢千里马的领路，感激地藏王的普渡。

sentences.english: Megan asked, trying to lead the way.
Well, the men and women of the type of 4)Reed and 5)Ross are there to show us the way.
sentences.chinese: 而给我们领路的正是像里德和罗斯这样的人。

sentences.english: They are guided by park rangers along the way.
sentences.chinese: 他们由园林官在沿线领路。

sentences.english: With the dogs leading, the police began to search for the criminal.
sentences.chinese: 有警犬在后面领路，警察动手搜求罪犯。

sentences.english: The guide slowly led through the pass's jaws.
sentences.chinese: 向导慢慢地领路通过关隘的狭口。

sentences.english: 15-15 The guides, as always, lie among the writers and artists.
sentences.chinese: 领路人依旧在作家和艺术家之中。

sentences.english: Well, the men and women of the type of Reed and Ross are there to show us the way.
sentences.chinese: 而给我们领路的正是像里德和罗斯这样的人。

sentences.english: It is essential that I lead the way.

sentences.chinese: 你们这瞎眼领路的有祸了。

sentences.english: To be a parent is to be a leader of young cubs.
sentences.chinese: 成为父母是作为你年轻孩子的领路者。

definition: to lead the way/to guide/to show the way/fig. to instruct
to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
to blindly follow suit (idiom)/to imitate slavishly/to do what everyone else is doing
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
